intro: Osbeckia senegambiensis, commonly known as the Senegambian osbeckia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a distinctive central disk. Osbeckia senegambiensis is often found in sandy soils and can be a component of shrubland or grassland ecosystems.
